verses.verse: O Israel,<WH3478> return<WH7725> unto<WH5704> the LORD<WH3068> thy God;<WH430> for<WH3588> thou hast fallen<WH3782> by thine iniquity.<WH5771>

Take <WH3947> with<WH5973> you words,<WH1697> and turn<WH7725> to<WH413> the LORD:<WH3068> say<WH559> unto<WH413> him, Take away<WH5375> all<WH3605> iniquity,<WH5771> and receive<WH3947> us graciously:<WH2895> so will we render<WH7999> the calves<WH6499> of our lips.<WH8193>

Asshur <WH804> shall not<WH3808> save<WH3467> us; we will not<WH3808> ride<WH7392> upon<WH5921> horses:<WH5483> neither<WH3808> will we say<WH559> any more<WH5750> to the work<WH4639> of our hands,<WH3027> Ye are our gods:<WH430> for<WH834> in thee the fatherless<WH3490> findeth mercy.<WH7355>
I will heal<WH7495> their backsliding,<WH4878> I will love<WH157> them freely:<WH5071> for<WH3588> mine anger<WH639> is turned away<WH7725> from<WH4480> him.
I will be<WH1961> as the dew<WH2919> unto Israel:<WH3478> he shall grow<WH6524> as the lily,<WH7799> and cast forth<WH5221> his roots<WH8328> as Lebanon.<WH3844>
His branches<WH3127> shall spread,<WH1980> and his beauty<WH1935> shall be<WH1961> as the olive tree,<WH2132> and his smell<WH7381> as Lebanon.<WH3844>

They that dwell<WH3427> under his shadow<WH6738> shall return;<WH7725> they shall revive<WH2421> as the corn,<WH1715> and grow<WH6524> as the vine:<WH1612> the scent<WH2143> thereof shall be as the wine<WH3196> of Lebanon.<WH3844>

Ephraim <WH669> shall say, What<WH4100> have I to do any more<WH5750> with idols?<WH6091> I<WH589> have heard<WH6030> him, and observed<WH7789> him: I<WH589> am like a green<WH7488> fir tree.<WH1265> From<WH4480> me is thy fruit<WH6529> found.<WH4672>

Who <WH4310> is wise,<WH2450> and he shall understand<WH995> these<WH428> things? prudent,<WH995> and he shall know<WH3045> them? for<WH3588> the ways<WH1870> of the LORD<WH3068> are right,<WH3477> and the just<WH6662> shall walk<WH1980> in them: but the transgressors<WH6586> shall fall<WH3782> therein.
